questionText: The school districts took measures included posting armed security officers in schools
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Teachers and principals were trained on responding to armed intruders.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: 12 students were killed at the fatal shootings at Columbine High School.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: 2 students were involved in the shooting at Columbine high School.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: One teacher was killed in the shooting at Columbine High School.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Schools have taken measures to prevent school violence and shootings.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: The killers in the Columbine incident were isolated and picked on by other students.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Measures were taken by schools to deter violence by emphasizing the climate rather than its physical security measures.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Two students killed 12 classmates and a teacher at Columbine High School.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: School teachers and principals were trained on conducting lockdowns.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Schools tightened access to campuses and improving screening for visitors.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Well-publicized school shootings took place in Colorado, Mississippi, Kentucky, Arkansas, and Oregon.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: School administrators are suspending any student who makes threats.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: The goal is to create a positive group atmosphere and to heal troubled students.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Another innovation in these schools is sponsoring a chapter of SAVE, Students Against Violence Everywhere.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Federal government studies have shown that young people are safe in school
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: There were violent occurrences in Littleton, Colorado and Jonesboro, Arkansas.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: School officials nationwide are taking precautions to prevent violence in their schools.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Lock-down practice has become commonplace.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Some school districts are requiring school uniforms.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Canvas book bags are banned in some places.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Many districts have gun-free campaigns.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Schools have had to implement measures to prevent tragedies due to violent occurrences and shootings.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Police offers are often assigned to schools, some armed.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Some schools require a dress code that does not allow baggy clothing.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Schools have established hot lines and tip boxes to find out about students with problems that could lead to violence.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Schools are trying to address the root cause of violent and anti-social behavior.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Some preventative measures are metal detectors and surveillance cameras.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Some schools have removed lockers that could be used to store weapons.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: At some schools, backpacks are prohibited.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Shootings resulting in the deaths of students and teachers have forced school authorities to implement measures to prevent more tragedy.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: Schools have made modifications or additions such as installing metal detectors and surveillance cameras.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: Greater involvement with law enforcement officials has led to police officers being assigned to schools.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: Some officers are armed and some bring dogs trained to sniff out explosives.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: Some schools require 'see through' book bags and prohibit backpacks.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: More schools are beginning to address the root causes of anti-social and violent behavior.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: Hot lines and tip boxes have been established to identify students with problems that could lead to violence.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: School systems are requiring accurate and timely reporting and tracking of threats and incidents.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: One Kentucky school district posted the Ten Commandments in each classroom.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: 20 states have laws requiring school safety plans.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Mississippi broadened its death penalty law to include killings on school campuses.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: The federal Gun Free Schools Act requires states enact school safety laws to receive federal aid.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Schools keep all but main doors locked.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Schools do lockdown drills.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: In some districts, police SWAT teams train at schools after hours.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Children are being taught to better deal with problems before they grow into rage.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: In some districts  security staff and local police maintain blueprints of local schools.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY
